title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
content: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
content: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: Rivers: No regrets, even with Colts 0-3 in return
content: Philip Rivers says he has no regrets about unretiring even though the Colts have gone 0-3 in his starts.

title: Bills QB Allen aggravates foot; X-rays negative
content: Quarterback Josh Allen's right foot became sore once again during the Bills' loss to the Eagles on Sunday.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
content: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.

title: Pels' Alvarado, Suns' Williams suspended for fight
content: Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado was suspended two games, and Suns center Mark Williams received a one-game suspension for their roles in a fight during the third quarter of Saturday night's game.

title: Eflin re-signs with Orioles on one-year, $10M deal
content: The Baltimore Orioles and right-hander Zach Eflin agreed on a one-year contract, reuniting the two sides as Baltimore continues investing in its roster after a disappointing 2025 season.

title: Panthers 'get to start the playoffs a week early'
content: The Panthers moved on quickly from Sunday's 27-10 loss to the Seahawks, already looking ahead to next weekend's likely winner-take-all NFC South showdown against the Buccaneers.

title: ðŸ‘€ How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (64!)
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense have one week to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

title: Despite red zone issues, Jaguars are one win from AFC South title
content: After a close win at the Colts, the Jaguars need a victory against Titans in Week 18 to secure the division.

title: Week 17 winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
content: Drake Maye, Derrick Henry and Chase Brown came up big when it mattered most in Week 17, while Jahmyr Gibbs and CeeDee Lamb were among the biggest disappointments.

title: 'Thank you Browns': Ravens give shoutout to rival for saving season
content: Baltimore now controls its division fate after Cleveland stunned Pittsburgh -- and the Ravens made sure to say thanks.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: The winner takes it all: Inside NFL division battles at the sportsbooks
content: At least two NFL divisions will be contested for during Week 18 of the NFL season after a wild Week 17.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye AZ midfielder Smit

title: Trump Asked If He Would Visit Ukraine To Ease Russia Tensions. What He Said
content: US President Donald Trump has insisted that peace negotiations aimed at ending the Russia-Ukraine war were "closer than ever before" following what he called a "terrific meeting" with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky at his Mar-a-Lago residence

title: Suriname Man Goes On Stabbing Spree After Fight With Wife, Kills His 4 Children
content: A man stabbed to death nine people, including five children, overnight in Suriname's capital Paramaribo, police said Sunday, adding the suspect was wounded and arrested.

title: 2-Year-Old Girl Among 6 Killed In Beachside Shooting In Ecuador
content: Multiple gunmen killed six people on Sunday, including a two-year-old girl, after shooting up a beachside boardwalk in southwestern Ecuador, police said.

title: In A First, South Korea To Allow Public Access To North Korea's Main Newspaper
content: South Korea said Friday it will reclassify North Korea's long-banned state newspaper as general information, easing public access, in the latest overture from the administration of dovish President Lee Jae Myung.

title: Pilot Dead, Another Critically Injured As 2 Helicopters Crash Midair In US
content: The Federal Aviation Administration described the crash as a midair collision between an Enstrom F-28A helicopter and Enstrom 280C helicopter over Hammonton Municipal Airport.

title: "80 Drones, 36 Hours": Pakistan Admits 'Nur Khan' Airbase Struck In Op Sindoor
content: The Pakistani government has acknowledged, for the first time in detail, the impact of India's strategic and precision strikes on its military installation under Operation Sindoor in May.

title: 2 Train Coaches With 158 Passengers Catch Fire In Andhra, 1 Killed
content: A man was killed after two compartments of the Tatanagar-Ernakulam Express caught fire at Yalamanchili, about 66 km from here, a senior police official said on Monday.

title: 16 Dead In Fire At A Retirement Home In Indonesia
content: A fire at a retirement home in the city of Manado on Indonesia's on Sulawesi island has killed 16 people, a local police official was quoted as saying on Monday by state news agency Antara.

title: Delhi Cops Arrest 5 After Video Of Them Doing Stunts On Road Goes Viral
content: The Delhi Police has arrested five people after registering an FIR in connection with a viral video that showed a group of men performing dangerous stunts in speeding cars on Delhi roads, an official said on Sunday.

title: 'Parivar Together': Pawars Reunite For Pimpri-Chinchwad Civic Polls
content: Elections to 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra, including the Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune civic bodies, will be held on January 15.

title: On Camera, Small Plane Crashes Into Sea In Brazil, Pilot Dies
content: Security camera footage released by authorities shows the plane diving nose-first into the sea near the beach around 12:30 pm (1530 GMT).

title: 13 Dead, 98 Injured After Train Derails In Mexico
content: Mexican authorities said on Sunday that at least 13 people were killed after an Interoceanic Train derailed in the southern state of Oaxaca. The Mexican Navy said the train, which derailed near the town of Nizanda, was carrying 250 people.

title: "Tamil Nadu Has Higher Debt Than UP": Row Over Congress Leader's Remark
content: Remarks by a Congress functionary have triggered a political row in Tamil Nadu, putting the DMK-Congress alliance in an uncomfortable position ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: Request Sonia Gandhi To Return Nehru's Letters To PM's Museum: Minister
content: Union Minister of Culture and Tourism Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Sunday urged former Congress president Sonia Gandhi to return the correspondences and documents of first prime minister Jawaharlal Nehru to the Prime Ministers' Museum and Library

title: 2.8 Crore Names Removed From UP's Draft Voter Rolls After SIR
content: The draft electoral roll in Uttar Pradesh, which will be published on December 31, is likely to have the names of about 12.55 crore voters, with almost 2.89 crore names deleted from the pre-SIR voter list.

title: Rolls-Royce Plans Making India Its 3rd "Home Market," Eyes Jet Engine

title: Amid Revanth Reddy-KCR Face-Off, Winter Session In Telangana From Tomorrow

content: Despite RBI guidelines and court rulings, borrowers say banks and recovery agents routinely resort to threats, intimidation and public shaming

content: Despite governmentâ€™s efforts to streamline the approval process, such as amendments to the Building Rules 2017, introducing the Self-Certification Scheme 2025, and abolishing the NALA Act, business has been slow, says A.P. CREDAI secretary

title: NITK uses machine learning to predict landslides in Western Ghats
content: The system combines rainfall analysis, real-time monitoring of soilÂ behaviourÂ and surface movement, and machine learning to provide reliable landslide warnings

content: Ownership papers handed over to families displaced in 1973 as Gujarat launches major urban infrastructure projects

title: WINGS Thiruvananthapuram bird count records 188 species
content: 85 species, the highest among the 10 regions surveyed, was spotted at Kottoor forests. Arippa forest also  emerged as a species-rich site, yielding 83 species

title: Kerala politics spills over to Karnataka after eviction drive in Bengaluru
content: The statements of Kerala CM and AICC general secretary after an eviction drive in Bengaluru are seen as part of a narrative building exercise ahead of Assembly elections in Kerala expected early next year

content: State-level Scouts and Guides Jamborette launched at Phoenix Public School in Honaga village of Belagavi district

title: At Indian History Congress, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan  calls for resisting political distortion of history
content: Pinarayi Vijayan urges historians to defend evidence-based scholarship amidst growing attempts to rewrite history for ideological purposes, highlighting the systematic removal of key historical themes and figures from educational syllabi.

title: Congress seeks disqualification of Agali panchayat president
content: Congress member N.K. Manju had switched sides and became president of the Agali grama panchayat with the support of the LDF

title: CPI(M) to hold protest assemblies against new MGNREGS regulations
content: The scheme, which was originally fully funded by Centre, has undergone a significant shift to a 60:40 cost-sharing ratio between the Centre and the State

title: Delhi AQI crosses 400: Dense fog disrupts flight ops across India
content: Thick smog and fog across northern India have led to significant flight delays, prompting the Ministry of Civil Aviation to issue a travel advisory. Airlines are urging passengers to check flight statuses and allow extra travel time as operations at select airports are impacted by reduced visibility and CAT III conditions.

title: Bangladesh polls: Students-led NCP divided over alliance with Jamaat; leaders quit, defections loom
content: The National Citizen Party (NCP), formed by leaders of the '2024 July Uprising,' is facing internal dissent. Thirty members oppose an alliance with Jamaat-e-Islami (JeI) for the upcoming polls due to JeI's controversial history. This has led to resignations, with some members considering rival parties or independent candidacies.

title: Rabies scare: 'Raita' made from dog-bitten buffaloâ€™s milk sparks panic; 200 line up for shots
content: Nearly 200 residents of Piprauli village in Uttar Pradesh received anti-rabies vaccinations as a precaution after consuming raita made from the milk of a buffalo that later died of suspected rabies. The buffalo had reportedly been bitten by a rabid dog, prompting health officials to administer vaccines to prevent any potential risk, though no disease has spread so far.

title: Silver's sparkling rally! Spot silver hits record high; surges past $80 an ounce mark
content: Silver prices soared past eighty dollars an ounce on Monday. Tight supplies and growing industrial demand fueled this rally. Platinum also touched a record high. Investors are watching for further US interest rate cuts. Gold prices eased slightly after reaching new highs. Geopolitical developments are also a key focus for traders.

title: AI chip shake-up: How Nvidiaâ€™s $20 bn deal could be a big win; Groq employees stand to gain
content: AI chip startup Groq has inked a non-exclusive licensing deal with Nvidia, reportedly valued at $20 billion. This agreement will see significant payouts for Groq employees and shareholders, with most of the fee disbursed upfront. While Groq will continue as an independent entity, key personnel, including its founder, will join Nvidia to advance licensed technology.

title: Blunt verdict! 'Shubman Gill can't be captain of all formats': Ex-England star explains reasons
content: Monty Panesarâ€™s remarks come at a time when India have struggled in Test cricket under head coach Gautam Gambhir, with the side suffering two whitewash defeats â€” 3-0 against New Zealand and 2-0 against South Africa. Speaking about Gambhirâ€™s tenure, Panesar said the former India opener has proven himself as a white-ball coach but still needs time and experience in red-ball cricket.

title: Air pollution: Delhi slips into â€˜severeâ€™ category as AQI hits 403; â€˜orange alertâ€™ issued
content: Delhi's air quality plunged to 'severe' levels with an AQI of 403, shrouded by toxic smog and dense fog. This hazardous pollution, exacerbated by calm winds and cold, is impacting visibility, delaying flights and trains. Health concerns are rising, especially for vulnerable groups, as experts predict the poor air to persist.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin revealed lessons learned from the initial Google Glass failure, emphasizing the need to fully develop products before flashy launches. He admitted to rushing commercialization, leading to a clunky design and high price.

title: Andhra Pradesh: 2 train coaches with 158 people catch fire on Ernakulam Express; 1 dead
content: A fire erupted in a coach of the Ernakulam Express early Monday, prompting an immediate halt at Yalamanchili railway station in Andhra Pradesh.  Railway staff swiftly detached unaffected coaches, ensuring all passengers were safely evacuated without injuries. An investigation into the cause of the blaze, which gutted two coaches, is underway.

title: 'Assaulted friends': Mob storms studentâ€™s party, thrashes guests for â€˜love jihadâ€™; FIR filed
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, assaulting guests and raising 'love jihad' slogans over the presence of Muslim attendees. Police initially fined victims before registering an FIR against the attackers following social media outrage. Claims of 'love jihad' were found to be untrue.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic CEOs express optimism about AI's role in development, urging developers to adapt.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,050; BSE Sensex near 85,100
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 26,050, BSE Sensex was above 85,000.

title: Ashes: 'Might drop 'very' from 'very good'' â€” Gavaskar after two-day Test at MCG
content: The Melbourne Cricket Ground witnessed an unprecedented two-day Test, sparking outrage over pitch quality.  Batting legend Sunil Gavaskar sarcastically questioned the contrasting ratings of the Perth and Melbourne pitches, highlighting the financial and sporting implications of the rapid finish.  He subtly critiqued the perceived double standards in evaluating groundsmen's work.

title: From jewellery to handbag - South Korea first lady accused of taking bribes over $200,000
content: South Korea's former first lady was alleged by prosecutors Monday to have accepted lavish bribes totalling over $200,000, including fine art, jewellery and a handbag, as well as meddling in state affairs. They alleged that bribes from businesses and politicians received by Kim totalled up to 377.25 million won ($263,000).

title: Watch: TVK chief Vijay trips, falls after being mobbed at Chennai airport
content: Actor-politician Vijay experienced a brief stumble at Chennai airport upon his return from Malaysia, as a surging crowd gathered around him. Security quickly assisted the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief, ensuring his safe entry into his car. The incident occurred after his attendance at the audio launch of his purported final film, Jananayagan.

title: Cold wave forces school closures in UP, Bihar, Jharkhand and Himachal
content: A severe cold wave has disrupted normal school schedules across several North Indian states. According to media reports, Uttar Pradesh has ordered the closure of all schools until January 1, 2026, while Bihar and Jharkhand have announced temporary closures with revised timings in some areas. Heavy snowfall has extended winter holidays in Himachal Pradesh. Rajasthan continues scheduled winter vacations, while schools in South and East India remain open with normal classes.

title: Dhruv Rathee responds to Janhvi Kapoor thumbnail backlash
content: A YouTube thumbnail featuring a before-and-after image of Janhvi Kapoor has snowballed into a major social media controversy. The image was used by Dhruv Rathee in his video discussing â€œfake beautyâ€ and cosmetic procedures, prompting sharp reactions online. Matters escalated when several users alleged that the video was a reaction to Janhviâ€™s recent post supporting Bangladeshi Hindus, with timing and visuals fuelling speculation.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd recommends buying Midwest, and Ambuja Cement. An 18% upside is seen in Midwest and a 35% upside in Ambuja Cement.

title: Mexico: 13 killed, over 100 injured after train derails; videos show scenes of chaos
content: A tragic derailment of the Interoceanic Train in southern Mexico has claimed at least 13 lives and injured 98 passengers. The accident occurred near Nizanda, halting vital rail traffic connecting the Pacific and Gulf coasts. Inaugurated last year, the train is a key part of Mexico's ambitious plan to develop the Isthmus of Tehuantepec into a major trade corridor.

title: Puppies burned to death in West Bengal for whimpering in cold
content: Four men allegedly burned five puppies to death in Howrah after being annoyed by their cries in the cold. The mother dog was also injured. Animal lovers have protested, demanding swift punishment for the perpetrators, who are currently at large as police investigate.

title: Nuclear readiness: North Korea tests 2 long-range cruise missiles -- watch
content: North Korea has launched two long-range cruise missiles, showcasing its nuclear combat readiness amid escalating regional tensions. Leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the drill, emphasizing self-defense and deterrence against perceived external threats. This demonstration follows Pyongyang's recent reveal of progress on its first nuclear-powered submarine, further heightening concerns on the Korean Peninsula.

title: 'Jassi bhai itna deep chale gaye': Axar Patel reveals Jasprit Bumrah's perfume obsession
content: Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has a surprising passion for perfumes. Teammate Axar Patel shared that Bumrah is deeply involved in understanding perfume composition. Bumrah even gifted a perfume to Siraj after a match. Patel also received a perfume gift from Bumrah. These anecdotes reveal a lighter side to the formidable bowler off the field.

title: Jake Paul & Jutta Leerdam net worth 2025: Olympics, boxing, business
content: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: Brittany Mahomes looks past Chiefs struggles; praises Patrickâ€™s off-field impact
content: Patrick Mahomes' 15 and the Mahomies Foundation is making a significant community impact, with partner Youth Volunteer Corps reporting over 92,000 volunteer hours and $3.2 million in community benefit. Brittany Mahomes actively supports these efforts, highlighting the foundation's growing influence beyond football.  The foundation's initiatives, like Read for 15 and Volunteer for 15, foster positive development in young people.

title: 'I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season': Travis Kelce
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection: Film breaks 'Pushpa 2' record to score highest 4th week collections
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, shattering records even in its fourth weekend. The film garnered an impressive Rs 57.75 crore over the weekend, pushing its total net collection to an estimated Rs 690.50 crore.  'Dhurandhar' has now secured the highest fourth-week collection for any Hindi film, surpassing 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2'.

title: 'Parivar coming togetherâ€™: NCP announces alliance with Sharad Pawar faction; seat-sharing pact soon
content: NCP chief Ajit Pawar has officially declared that his party and NCP (SP) will unite for the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation elections.  Addressing a rally, Pawar confirmed the alliance, stating it's a family coming together for the greater good of Maharashtra. Seat-sharing details are expected within two days, signaling a significant political consolidation.

title: PM Modi to chief secretaries: Ensure Maoism doesnâ€™t relapse
content: Prime Minister Modi urged chief secretaries to prevent Maoism's resurgence in liberated areas by accelerating infrastructure and welfare projects. He emphasized all-round development, including rehabilitation for surrendered individuals, to ensure they remain in the mainstream. The PM also called for "deregulation cells" to boost reforms and improve ease of living and doing business.

title: 'Mystery doctor' of Dandakaranya: A shadowy figure with scalpel whoâ€™s been aiding Maoists
content: A former MBBS doctor, known as Dr. Rafiq, built a clandestine medical system for Maoists and Adivasis in Chhattisgarh's Bastar. He performed surgeries with limited resources, trained medics, and documented treatments for battlefield injuries and common ailments. Revered by locals, his network continues to function even after his departure, blending traditional knowledge with modern medicine.

title: Trump says, â€˜Russia wanted Ukraine to succeed' in front of Zelenskyy â€” watch his reaction
content: President Trump stated Russia desires Ukraine's success, even offering low-cost energy, a remark that visibly surprised and amused President Zelenskyy. The two leaders met at Mar-a-Lago to discuss peace talks, though their underlying relationship dynamics remained unchanged.

title: IWT put on hold: Government clears another Chenab hydel project; follows Sawalkot nod
content: India is advancing its hydropower potential on the Chenab River with the approval of the 260 MW Dulhasti State-II project in Jammu & Kashmir. This strategic move, following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, aims to harness the river's untapped capacity. The project, an extension of an existing facility, will contribute to India's hydropower generation goals.

title: Nikki Bella fuels Cooper DeJean dating rumors by wearing his Eagles jersey
content: Speculation is rife about WWE star Nikki Bella and Eagles cornerback Cooper DeJean dating. Bella's recent social media posts, including wearing a DeJean jersey and being seen in the Eagles locker room, have fueled the rumors. DeJean's appearance at a WWE event and a John Cena-inspired celebration after an interception have also added to the buzz.

title: Burnt face, bound limbs: Woman found murdered, stuffed in bag at Noida dumping yard
content: An unsettling discovery has shaken Noida's Sector 142, where the lifeless body of an unidentified woman was found, bound and burned, in a refuse site. Local law enforcement is facing hurdles in identifying the young victim, likely in her early twenties, largely due to sparse surveillance in the isolated area.

title: Ind vs SL: Smriti Mandhana scripts history; joins elite club to become the fastest toâ€¦
content: Smriti Mandhana achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second Indian woman to score over 10,000 international runs. She reached this landmark during the T20I against Sri Lanka. Mandhana's career includes impressive statistics across all formats. She also holds records in T20Is and ODIs. Following the T20I series, she will captain Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Women's Premier League.

title: Understanding the OMAD diet: How eating one meal a day affects your overall health
content: Eating just one meal a day, known as OMAD, is an extreme intermittent fasting method. While it can lead to weight loss by creating a calorie deficit and potentially boost metabolism, it carries significant risks. These include nutrient deficiencies, low energy, and potential negative impacts on health, especially if not carefully planned and supervised.

title: Ministers briefed to counter Congress over VB-G RAM G; ministry sends detailed report
content: The government is preparing to defend its new rural employment scheme, VB-G RAM G, against Congress protests. Ministers have been briefed on its advantages, including 125 guaranteed workdays and durable asset creation, aiming to boost local livelihoods and curb migration.  Normative funding ensures predictable allocations, contrasting with previous models.

title: SC saved Aravalis for 20 yrs, and PMO on two occasions; experts slam new report
content: The Supreme Court has consistently safeguarded the Aravalis for two decades, banning mining and groundwater extraction. Despite PMO interventions to prevent dilution of construction norms in ecologically sensitive zones, recent government reports appear to favor mining. Activists highlight ongoing efforts, particularly from Haryana, to permit non-forest activities under the guise of recreation, challenging the court's conservation directives.

title: Now, India, Bangladesh face off over Hadi's killers
content: Bangladesh claims murder suspects of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi have fled to Meghalaya, India. However, Indian security agencies, including the BSF and Meghalaya DGP, have strongly refuted these allegations, stating there is no evidence of any fugitive crossing the border. They dismissed the claims as fabricated and emphasized robust border surveillance.

title: Post-Op Sindoor, DRDO transfers key camouflage, deception techs to Army
content: India's DRDO has equipped the Army with advanced camouflage software and a multispectral tank decoy to counter modern enemy detection. These technologies, developed after recent conflicts, help soldiers and equipment evade surveillance across visible, infrared, and radar spectrums. This boosts battlefield deception and survival, crucial for modern warfare.

title: Aravalli row: Jairam Ramesh questions ministry's stance; SC to hear case today
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh questioned Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on the new Aravalli definition ahead of a Supreme Court hearing. He highlighted concerns about ecological integrity, citing FSI reports that emphasized the protective role of even smaller hill formations against desertification. Ramesh also pointed to past definitions and a CEC report on mining leases within the Aravallis.

title: Pink Saheli card: Delhi Aadhaar mandatory for free bus rides for women in 2026
content: Starting January, Delhi's Pink Saheli card initiative will grant women free access to public bus rides, striving for enhanced transparency and convenience. Women aged 12 and over who call Delhi home will utilize this modern smart card, which replaces traditional paper tickets.

title: US: 1 dead as two helicopters collide mid-air; video shows thick smoke
content: Two helicopters collided mid-air and crashed in Hammonton, New Jersey, with one aircraft fully engulfed in flames. Emergency crews are on scene, actively extricating at least one patient from the wreckage. The investigation is ongoing, and the public is urged to avoid the area.

title: Brittany Mahomes shifts focus as Patrick Mahomes nears Chiefsâ€™ final game
content: Patrick Mahomes' wife, Brittany Mahomes, has often been spotted cheering on her husband and being there for him throughout all the seasons he has played in. With this season being a huge disappointment for the Kansas City Chiefs' fans and Patrick Mahomes sustaining a brutal injury, his wife, Brittany Mahomes has made it clear what are her priorities, as the team gears up for the last match this season.

title: 10 Indians dead fighting in Ukraine war, says man who went to Russia
content: A Jalandhar man's search for his brother in Moscow has revealed a grim reality: at least ten Indians, including three from Punjab, have died fighting for the Russian army in Ukraine, with four others missing. Jagdeep Kumar, who made two trips to Russia, has obtained official confirmation of these deaths and is now working to repatriate the bodies.

title: Matthew Stafford vs. Drake Maye: Inside the odds, betting for the NFL's MVP race
content: quarterbacks Matthew Stafford and Drake Maye lead the pack for the award . the 37-year-old has a commanding -360 odds lead to win the award, according to draftKings . he started the campaign with +3500 odds to earn the NFL's highest individual honor .

title: Where did the Staubach-Pearson 'Hail Mary' football end up after 50 years?
content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . it was purported to be the quarterback's touchdown pass from Roger Staubach . he has long wanted a game-worn jersey of a Cowboys' Ring of Honor member .

title: Grading coaching hires: Kyle Whittingham, Michigan agree to deal
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . sign up now New hires always come with hope and optimism, grand proclamations and the chance to get programs on right track .

title: The good, bad and ugly of Week 17: Big wins for Niners, Eagles, but what happened to Steelers, Bucs and Packers?
content: texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . quarterback Derrick Henry carried the Ravens to victory over the Packers . the 49ers missed their chance to win the AFC North by losing a low-scoring affair to the Browns .

title: PM warns on antibiotic misuse: Modi urges restraint to curb resistance
content: Health experts have repeatedly cautioned that antimicrobial resistance is emerging as one of Indiaâ€™s most serious public health challenges Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience.
